edu.utsa.mobbed

Class EventTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.utsa.mobbed.EventTypes

  • public class EventTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    Handler class for EVENT_TYPES table. Event types facilitate tagging and association of events across multiple datasets.
    Author:
    Arif Hossain, Jeremy Cockfield, Kay Robbins

      Creates a EventTypes object.

        public void reset(java.lang.String eventType,

        eventTypeDescription - the description of the event type

      • save

        public void save()
          throws MobbedException
        Saves all event types as a batch. All event types in the batch will be successfully written or the operation will be aborted.
        Throws:
        MobbedException - if an error occurs

      • addNewEventTypes

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,EventTypeTags> addNewEventTypes(java.sql.Connection dbCon,
                                                                 java.lang.String[] eventTypeUuids,
                                                                 java.lang.String[] uniqueTypes,
                                                                 java.lang.String[][] eventTypeTags)
                                                                          throws MobbedException
        Adds new event types to the database
        Parameters:
        dbCon - a connection to the database
        eventTypeUuids - the existing event type uuids
        uniqueTypes - the names of the event types
        eventTypeTags - the new tags
        Returns:
        a hashmap that contains the event types and tags
        Throws:
        MobbedException - if an error occurs

      • getStringValues

        public static java.lang.String[] getStringValues(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,EventTypeTags> hashmap)
        Gets the string representation of the event type UUIDs.
        Parameters:
        hashmap - a hashmap that contains the event type UUIDs
        Returns:
        the string representation of the event type UUIDs
